chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Nicholas D Hall was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas D Hall is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Nicholas D Hall was found guilty of Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident, Habitual Criminality], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.
  • Nicholas D Hall was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident, Habitual Criminality], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: with current sentence; credit for 74 days served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with firearms
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition

No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim unless approved by Court. 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Attend parenting classes.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample if not already given, his voting rights are suspended.
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas D Hall in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Nicholas D Hall in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Based upon certified records, Court found that defendant is a repeater.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with current sentence; credit for 74 days served.  Court ordered 3 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 3 YEARS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by Court.
- 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample if not already given, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

Defendant Nicholas D Hall in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Nicholas D Hall in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On the same day, at the hour of 1:39 pm the jury returned and by the foreperson brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3, AND NOT GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 4, which were read in open court. The Court polled the Jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdicts.  Jury verdicts received and filed.  Jury discharged.  The Court denied the defense motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdict as to Counts 1 and 3 and granted motion for judgments of acquittal as to Counts 2 and 4.  The Court granted the State's motion for judgment on the verdicts as to Counts 1 and 3 and ordered that judgments of conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas D Hall not in court, defendant in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Jury resumed deliberations at 8:40 am in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies M. Tinsley and S. Urbaniak who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Nicholas D Hall in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Nicholas D Hall in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
 Jury in the box at 1:49 pm.  Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officers Jullian Goggins and Jedidiah Thompson. State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Sidebars put on the record.  Defense motion for mistrial denied by the Court.  Stipulations put on the record.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Defendant examined by the Court as to his right to testify or not to testify and Court found defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to testify.  Jury in the box.  Stipulation read to the jury. Defense rests.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:35 pm.  to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies S. Urbaniak and Marlyn Tinsley who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jurors excused for the eveing at 4:55 pm.  Jury trial continued to 8/06/14 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas D Hall in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Nicholas D Hall in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Jury in the box at 11:10 am.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Telecomminicator David Pawlak. Exhibit  1,2 and 27 received.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Jullian Goggans.  Exhibit #'s 3 through 25 received.  Jury excused for lunch at 12:00 pm.  Sidebars put on the record.  Jury trial continued to 1:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas D Hall in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Nicholas D Hall in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  3:10 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Jury excused for the evening at 4:47 pm.  Jury trial continued to 8/05/14 at 9:30 pm.  Sidebars put on the record.

Defendant Nicholas D Hall not in court, defendant in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Attorney Martin R Tanz in court, defendant Nicholas D Hall not in court, in custody.  Ryan T Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Defendant was not produced by the state and the victim informed the state she could not appear on this date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Martin R Tanz in court, defendant Nicholas D Hall not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt and Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Court has a speedy trial ready to proceed and ordered matter adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 5/07/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Argument on state's motion to admit 911 calls heard.  For reasons stated on the record Court will allow the 1st call be admitted but will not allow the 2nd call be admitted.

Defendant Nicholas D Hall in court with attorney Martin R Tanz.  Defendant Nicholas D Hall in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Attorney Martin R Tanz in court, defendant Nicholas D Hall not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial and motion.  Due to Court's calendar, matter must be adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas D Hall in court with attorney Martin Tanz.  Defendant Nicholas D Hall in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #08CM6926 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Debbie Allen.  Exhibit #1 received.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Exhibit withdrawn.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kevia J

Defendant Nicholas D Hall in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Nicholas D Hall in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Defense moves to dismiss Count 4.  Arguments heard.  Court grants request and orders Count 4 dismissed.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
